title: Bug 9619: Move static member: Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member: Dialog details

20020212a. Mnemonics
b. No validation on the type field. It is not too expensive to check for the existence of the type (as it is already done in the type wizard for the super class), so it could be implemented.

At least isValidTypeName

f. The label could say 'Select destination type:'

g. The browse button is too small. It should use SWTUtil for standard button sizes.

c. The title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.

e. The destination type can be the same as the source type. Refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.

Expected Behavior:

I would use the title for 'Move static field(s)' and use the description for 'x fields from xx'.

d. Selection dialog should be initialized with the type currently entered.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the move static member dialog.
2. Try to move a static member to a non-existent type.
3. Observe that there is no validation on the type field and it allows you to proceed.
4. Go to the next page and observe that it says 'Type not found'.
5. Observe that the browse button is too small.
6. Observe that types from other projects are shown in the dialog.
7. Try to move a static member to the same type it is currently in.
8. Observe that refactoring warns of errors and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
9. Observe that the move static field(s) dialog does not use the title for its text.
10. Observe that the selection dialog is not initialized with the type currently entered.
OB:
1. Browse button is too small.
2. Title is used for long text and it says 'Type not found' when going to the next page. Types from other projects are shown in the dialog.
3. Destination type can be the same as the source type and causes refactoring warnings and pseudo changes in referencing classes.
EB:
1. The title should be used for 'Move static field(s)' and the description for 'x fields from xx'.
2. The browse button should use SWTUtil for standard button sizes.
3. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
4. The destination type should be allowed to be the same as the source type without warnings and pseudo changes.
5. The selection dialog should be initialized with the type currently entered.
SR:
1. Open the move static member dialog.
2. Try to move a static member to a non-existent type.
3. Go to the next page and observe the error message.
4. Observe the size of the browse button.
5. Observe that types from other projects are shown in the dialog.
6. Try to move a static member to the same type it is currently in.
7. Observe the warnings and pseudo changes.
8. Observe that the move static field(s) dialog does not use the title for its text.
9. Observe that the selection dialog is not initialized with the type currently entered.
